title: Nicotine+ 1.2.9 with internal GTK+2 (alt. Soulseek) - Portable
description:
Nicotine v1.2.9 with internal GTK+ v2.14.4 (2008-11-11) Portable.

One single portable version.

So what is this?

For ages, people have used Soulseek to download just about any MP3 file you can imagine, it is a specialist thing really, where no matter how rare the MP3 is, it always seems to be there!

Now, Soulseek is okay but it looks horrible, like a Windows 95 program or something, so I found a new one that is supposed to be for Linux called "Nicotine+" which uses the Soulseek server... it is Soulseek as far as usage goes, it does the same thing but is far better than Soulseek, has more features etc.

________________________________________________________________________


1 - Make certain that you share your MP3&#039;s. You can&#039;t just tell it to download to a folder and they get shared - they do not get shared unless you also set up a sharing folder. Most P2P apps will share your "incoming" folder automatically, Nicotine+ doesn&#039;t do this unless you tell it to, so bear it in mind because people will ban you on principle from downloading from them, if you do not share!

2 - When you run this portable version, type your user name and password in. 

3 - After that, close the program. Then open the program again. This will save the user name and password and you are connected now, you can search, download and so on.

4 - The default "Incomplete file directory" is alongside the portable application:
NicPlus%ProgramFilesDir%Nicotine+Downloads-Incomplete

The default "Download directory" is alongside the portable application:
NicPlus%ProgramFilesDir%Nicotine+Downloads-Finished

You can change these if you want, but make sure to close and restart the program.

5 - Chat rooms - to make it "save" a chat room (re-connect to the chat room when the program starts) make sure you tick "Auto Join" on the right of the chat window. You can untick the "Nicotine" chat room if you wish, no one in there knows about music BTW.

6 - When you close this program you always get an error - saying look in a "logfile" but just ignore this error. Also ignore how the tray icon stays there after the program is closed, it doesn&#039;t matter, many programs do that, I would blame Windows (not refreshing task bar properly) more than the program.

________________________________________________________________________

EXE file MD5:
7A44056FABFDCF7969BDACA97B540F97

________________________________________________________________________
